content.description: Fun little climb, start inside the crack and wedge your way up. Lots of alternatives and fun ways to climb this one (like upside down). Still a little bit dirty but I’m sure after I go and scrub it somemore and people start using it will become a nice addition to the Garden.
content.location: Little cave just left of Gumby slab.

content.description: An excellent problem with a lot of movement. Works up the stand alone prow near Garden Variety. Start low and heal out right on a good ledge. From there work up to the inverted V pinch and left to the arete. From there it is a long committing move to the slopers on the top. For the topout there is a ledge/jug that is a little hard to find but makes it easier. Not a bad idea to go check out the topout before hand and locate the hold as it is a bit high to fall from there.
content.protection: At least 3 pads as this problem works the prow hard right to left.

content.description:
Worthwhile if you cant do the lower start. Begin compressing with hands on the arrets of the prow. 

  I added this variation as well as the high one because I've seen all three routes go by the same name from different sources. Each variation is enjoyable in its own right.
Start with small holds at waist level. Technical footwork at the start. Intense cleaning was required so be careful on slightly dirty top out.
content.location: Just to the right of The Locksmith on the main trail. Top out and walk down by the warm up slab area.

content.description: Sit start with a sidepull up to good face hold on the steep face. The crux comes when transitioning to the arete and slab. Don't screw up the upper slab.
content.location: Continue on the main trail past The Siren until the trail starts heading down hill. Top out and walk down to the warm up slab area.

content.description: Sit start for "into the Light" . Left hand mini-pinch: right hand above head on wet sloper: powerful throw to pitiful right hand pinch on arete, controlled static move to undercling with left hand, then another big move to right hand jug, then finishes via "into the light"
content.location: start sitting on the flat boulder in the "into the light cave"

content.description: There are many cave systems that run under the boulders of the Garden; one such smaller cave beneath the Azian boulder houses a V-hard steep problem that makes it way out of the cave floor to top out above the base of Azians Crack.  If you find yourself in a  large set of caves with multiple entrances and exits, wrong cave.  Into The Light has a very small cave thats typically littered with beer cans.

Theres a nice traverse on the gumby slab that I've never seen shared before or listed in either guidebook.Start on the gumby arete and traverse from left to right finishing up gumby crack. Avoid the excellent flat hand shelf or it degrades the problem to a V0
content.protection: Flat landing, one of the best in the gardens.
content.location: Gumby slab.Back back.On the Azain Boulder right of garden variety and the siren.

content.description: Start on the left of the Gumby Slab on a softball and a good undercling, follow the large rail, set your feet and jump for the mantle ledge. This is an eliminate problem minimize using crimpers for maximum fun!
content.protection: 0-1 pads the landing is uncharacteristically good for the garden
content.location: Starting from the road follow the trail past the v0 warm up boulder, continue up the tail past "the good" and turn left into a hallway taking you to the gumby slab the original warm up boulder before the logging road became off limits.

content.description: Classic gardens warm up. Stand start under a large rail.
content.protection: pads (one is sufficient, but more is better)
content.location: Around the corner to the right of the Siren, This climb is easily identified by the large rail ~7ft off the ground. If you take the trail in from the forest road this is the first climb that you will see.

content.description: Left most route on the gumby wall. Start start on good holds, move up through good holds to a somewhat delicate topout.
content.location: Right of the Siren, left of gumby slab. In the way back.

content.description:
A fun powerful sidepull problem.  The starting holds are a bit of a reach so stacking a few pads will help.  Put your feet on the obvious rail/crimp and slap up through to the top. 

  There might be some potential for a wicked lower start to this problem off of the starting footholds but it'd probably go at V10+.
content.location: This problem is on the overhanging wall in the very back off the main trail. It starts near the middle on a pinch about 7ft. up.

content.description: One of the only roped climbs at the garden.
content.protection: 1 bolt + Anchors, Optional gear to .75 (Blue Alien and Green/Yellow Hybrid Alien protect the first part) or a crash pad.
content.location: This route is located on the south side of the giant main boulder in the Garden. Climb the obvious scrubbed crack to a bulge, and bolt, clip the bolt surmount the bulge and move to anchors.

content.description: Start on the obvious jug, get your feet high or keep them low in an often wet crack and pop up to more good holds. Balance heavy top out.
content.location: From the road, take the trail to the toilet bowl boulder and walk all the way up, past the methlab to a hall with two huge boulders take a left and follow until you see it. to the right of the locksmith. To the left of siren.

content.description: Starts on a blocky section under the obvious white prow. Move up and left. Climb really starts at the transition onto the prow. Potentially a bad fall from these first few moves. Big holds out to the end of the prow then up over the top.
content.protection: 3 or more pads. At least two spotters.
content.location: Block to the right of the warm-up slab by Siren.

content.description: Sit start immediately right of Siren on good blocky holds, traverse right and around the corner, finish up the Gumby Arete.
content.location: Located in the way back near garden variety,  siren and the gumby wall.

content.description: Azain is the largest formation of the area and it hosts many quality boulder problems. On the down hill side it will appear as a 30-40' cliff behind the Methlab formation. Most of the climbs are on the uphill side.
